Enduring Understandings:
1. Absolute zero is the point at which all molecular movement stops. Absolute zero can be used as a reference point between degrees Kelvin, Celsius, and Fahrenheit.
2. To convert from Celsius to Kelvin, add 273.15. To convert from Kelvin to Celsius, subtract 273.15. To convert from Fahrenheit to Celsius, subtract 32 and multiply by 5/9. To convert from Celsius to Fahrenheit, multiply by 9/5 and add 32.
Vocabulary: absolute zero

STEM Skills:
1. Review converting between units.
